description: The Ecole Technique - Ecole des MÃ©tiers de Lausanne (ETML) is a state-run vocational and trade school that trains young people on a dual basis in theoretical vocational courses and full-time in practical and theoretical disciplines.
I entered the electronics training program, but unfortunately left after my 1st year due to a lack of interest in the field.

SeMo is a transitional measure to prepare for vocational training. It was initiated by SECO (the Swiss Secretariat for Economic Affairs) and is subsidized by the Employment Service through the Unemployment Insurance scheme.

Founded in Lausanne in 1895, Vaudoise is one of Switzerland's ten leading private insurance companies. Vaudoise is the only independent private insurer whose decision-making center is based in French-speaking Switzerland. It operates in the Swiss insurance and pensions market through around one hundred general and local agencies.
I joined Vaudoise Assurance to complete my 4-year dual apprenticeship in IT.
